content: albert de moncerf socks by caoua coffee materials fingering weight sock yarn 400yds/365m 460yds/420m sample sweetgeorgia tough love sock 80% wool 20% nylon needles us1 / 2 25mm and us1 5 / 2 5mm or needle size needed to obtain gauge stitch marker tapestry needle size adult s/m m/l gauge 34 sts / 42 row= 4 inches in stockinette on smaller needles abbreviations k = knit stitch k2tog = knit 2 sts together m1 = make 1 by inserting the left needle tip from front to back under the bar that runs between the stitch you just worked and the next stitch then knitting this strand through the back loop p = purl stitch p2tog = purl 2 sts together rs = right side / public side / outside of sock sl yb = slip_stitch as if to purl with yarn in back back = the side away from you sl yf = slip_stitch as if to purl with yarn in front front = the side closest to you ssk = slip 1 knit wise slip 1 purl wise knit both stitches together through the back loops st s = stitch es ws = wrong side / private side / inside of sock 2/2 lc = 4 stitch left leaning cable worked with cable needle slip 2 sts onto cable needle and hold in front k2 k2 from cable needle worked without cable needle approaching from the back insert the tip of the right needle into the round th back of the 3 and 4 st on the left needle drop 4 sts off the left needle and pick up the 2 loose sts from the front with the left needle transfer 2 sts back from right needle to left needle k4 ©caoua coffee 2016 pattern is for non-commercial personal use only all rights reserved albert de moncerf v 1 page 1/5 albert de moncerf socks - by caoua coffee before you start some notes on size the cables in this pattern draw the fabric in therefore the cuff worked over 60 70 sts on larger needles stretches to about the same circumference than the leg smaller needles 70 84 sts per round therefore check to make sure you can get the cuff over you heel than the rest should be fine if the larger size isn t wide enough for the intended feet then you could use a yarn that s on the thicker side of fingering and gives you a bigger gauge 7 - 8 sts/inch instead of the 8 5sts/inch the pattern calls for please be aware that you ll need a bit more yardage than with thinner yarn pattern cuff with larger needles cast on 60 72 sts place marker and join to start working in the round work k2 p2 ribbing for 12 15 rounds leg setup change to smaller needles and work next 2 rounds as follows increase round * k2 m1 k6 m1 k4 repeat from * to end now you have 70
